snippet: It was unclear whether the children succumbed to gas asphyxiation — lack of oxygen — or died from a lethal dose of some kind of poison, a police official said.
abstract: New York City police officers responding to a call about a gas leak find Lisette Bamenga and her two children, 5-year-old Trevor Noel Jr and 4-month-old Lillian Noel, unconscious in the kitchen of their Bronx apartment; both children die and the mother is in stable condition in what police believe was a suicide attempt by Barnenga; father of the deceased children is New York Police Officer Trevor Noel.

byline.original: By WENDY RUDERMAN and COLIN MOYNIHAN

lead_paragraph: It was unclear whether the children succumbed to gas asphyxiation — lack of oxygen — or died from a lethal dose of some kind of poison, a police official said.

headline.seo: 2 Bronx Children Die After Mother Turns on Gas And Cuts Wrists
headline.main: 2 Bronx Children Die After Their Mother Turns on Gas and Slits Her Wrists
headline.print_headline: 2 Bronx Children Die After Their Mother Turns on Gas and Slits Her Wrists
